meanings.definition: relating to or affecting the extremities
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the patient with acrotic fingers.
meanings.sent2: She wore warm socks to protect her acrotic toes from the cold.
meanings.sent3: In winter, Jack's acrotic hands turned a funny shade of blue.
meanings.sent4: The acrotic branches of the tree reached out like frozen fingers.
meanings.sent5: The image of the acrotic feet stuck in the snow was haunting.

meanings.definition: pertaining to the outermost part of a structure
meanings.sent1: The acrotic layer of the skin was exposed to the harsh sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The acrotic edge of the cliff was dangerous to approach.
meanings.sent3: The acrotic tip of the pencil broke off while writing.
meanings.sent4: The acrotic rim of the cup was chipped and sharp.
meanings.sent5: The acrotic border of the map marked the boundary clearly.

meanings.definition: characterized by a lack of blood flow to the extremities
meanings.sent1: The acrotic condition in her hands made them numb and pale.
meanings.sent2: His acrotic feet felt cold and lifeless.
meanings.sent3: The acrotic fingers struggled to grip the pen.
meanings.sent4: The acrotic toes tingled as blood circulation improved.
meanings.sent5: The acrotic limbs needed urgent medical attention.
